scene.line: The moment I now recall most clearly from their short visit was the birdcage exhibit.
The old man stopped to rest â€” or maybe to think. The young woman had been anxious up to that point, but she stopped as well, and examined the birdcage more closely.
It seemed to elicit a tenderness from her. She ran one fingernail along the bars of the wire cage, marking out a tuneless scale, like a child's xylophone.
